title: Texas Roadhouse upgraded after earnings beat, shares soar 13%
text: Texas Roadhouse Inc. TXRH, +16.16% shares soared 13.3% in Tuesday premarket trading after the restaurant chain reported third-quarter earnings and sales that beat expectations and was upgraded at Raymond James to outperform from market perform. Raymond James has a $63 price target. Texas Roadhouse had net income totaling $36.5 million, or 52 cents per share, up from $29.1 million, or 40 cents per share, last year. Revenue totaled $650.5 million, up from $594.6 million. The FactSet consensus was for EPS of 46 cents and revenue of $648.0 million. Same-restaurant sales rose 4.4% at company-owned restaurants, in line with the FactSet consensus, and were up 3.2% at domestic franchised locations. Texas Roadhouse said same-restaurant sales were up 5.3% for the first four weeks of the fourth quarter, and reiterated same-restaurant sales growth for 2019. For 2020, the company is guiding for positive same-store sales as well. "We believe improved labor productivity reflected in the company's 3Q results/guidance should remove a key overhang in the stock," wrote Raymond James. "The company is also sustaining powerful comp outperformance with positive traffic in a slightly negative industry comp backdrop." Texas Roadhouse stock has taken a 16% tumble in 2019, while the S&P 500 index SPX, +0.00% is up 21.2% for the period.
